title: Great Smoky Mountains National Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations               Permits & Reservations       Permits  Wedding Permits: Plan your special day in the park. Special Use Permits: Required for certain organized activities and events. 1st Amendment Activities: Political events, public assemblies, demonstrations, the distribution of literature, church services and other similar activities. Commercial Filming and Still Photography: Learn about guidelines and requirements. Commercial Services Permits: Required to conduct business in the park. Scatter Cremated Ashes: Parties must follow all conditions of attached letter of permission. Permit for Scientific Research and Collecting: For questions pertaining to research projects in the park, please e-mail or call (828) 926-6251 or visit the website of the Appalachian Highlands Learning Center. Cave Exploration Permits: Not issued at this time due to issues concerning white nose syndrome in bats. Fishing: Requires a valid Tennessee or North Carolina license in the park.          Frontcountry campgrounds are busy in peak season - reservations are recommended.  Amy Nichter Photo  Reservations Camping and Lodging If you plan to spend a night in the park, reservations may be necessary. Please refer to the following pages for reservation information: Backcountry Camping Frontcountry Camping Le Conte Lodge Horse Camps Group Campgrounds Picnic Pavilions (Day Use Only) The Appalachian Clubhouse and Spence Cabin Two rustic, historic buildings located in the heart of the park, the Appalachian Clubhouse and Spence Cabin can be rented for wedding receptions, family reunions, business meetings, and more.
